meanings.definition: A track or set of tracks made of steel rails along which trains run.
meanings.sent1: The railroad tracks stretched far into the distance.
meanings.sent2: The train chugged along the railroad, carrying passengers to their destination.
meanings.sent3: I dreamt of a giant squirrel running along the railroad tracks collecting acorns.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled along the railroad of memories, stopping at each station of the past.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the train whistle echoed through the valley, a lonely cry along the steel railroad tracks.

meanings.definition: To transport or convey by railroad.
meanings.sent1: They decided to railroad the goods to the city for faster delivery.
meanings.sent2: The company used to railroad supplies to remote areas before the road was built.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to railroad the picnic basket away from the campers.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to railroad him into agreeing with her, even though he had his doubts.
meanings.sent5: The excitement of the journey railroaded her thoughts, leaving no room for worries about the destination.

meanings.sent1: The group tried to railroad him into joining their club against his will.
meanings.sent2: She felt like her boss was trying to railroad her into working overtime again.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten railroaded the dog into chasing its tail instead of napping.
meanings.sent4: The fear of failure railroaded him into making a hasty decision.
meanings.sent5: The hypnotic rhythm of the music railroaded the audience into a state of euphoria.
